title: Watch: Dude tries shoplifting from convenience store, gets dropkicked into beer section for his troubles
description:
During my younger days, while working in retail, we were told not to confront shoplifters. Yet, we were still responsible for SHRINK, which was what they called money lost from stolen merchandise. This was in a bygone era when shoplifting was frowned upon, long before liberal voters elected liberal politicians with liberal policies that have made stealing legal-ish. So I understand this employee's frustration working an overnight at a convenience store.

Was booting an (alleged) shoplifter into the soda aisle an overreaction? I'm not one to judge.

NIAGARA FALLS ACTION: this video footage is allegedly from the 7-Eleven at 29th and Pine Avenue on April 9th, 2022, around 2330 hours. The individual with the backpack was supposedly stealing merchandise from the store. This prompted the employee to aggressively kick the person. pic.twitter.com/orFa3DAaqK
— Niagara Action (@NiagaraAction) April 21, 2022

The standard viral video disclaimers apply. Allow for missing context. This only looks like shoplifting. Maybe the customer and the employee got into an argument about Florida's parental rights bill, and the clerk took things too far. Maybe they are independent pro wrestlers who were filming an angle for YouTube. 2022 is a wacky year. However, this was spliced together from security footage, so someone in the store thought it was shoplifting.

And shout out to whoever thought to give us multiple angles. Seeing the guy get yeeted into a refrigerator is what makes this quality content.

We can expect to see more videos like this. As shoplifting is on the rise and shoplifters are getting away consequence-free, more and more Americans are going to take matters into their own hands. But proceed with caution. If you live in an area that values criminals, there's an above-average chance it's an area that comes down hard on citizens who follow the law.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Don Lemon spreads fake news about getting fired by CNN, gets called out for it... by CNN
description:
Today has seen a lot of shakeups in the media world. First, Charles Barkley was added to CNN's lineup, then Tucker Carlson left Fox News. And now, in dramatically less important news, Don Lemon has been given the boot from CNN.

Lemon tweeted out the news this afternoon:

"I was informed this morning by my agent that I have been terminated by CNN. I am stunned. After 17 years at CNN I would have thought that someone in management would have had the decency to tell me directly. At no time was I ever given any indication that I would not be able to continue to do the work I have loved at the network. It is clear that there are some larger issues at play. With that said, I want to thank my colleagues and the many teams I have worked with for an incredible run. They are the most talented journalists in the business, and I wish them all the best."

\u201chttps://t.co/8PyLqvS0d7\u201d
— Don Lemon (@Don Lemon) 1682352854

So that's sad. Kind of. (Not really.)

Except it isn't even true. CNN PR had to publicly fact check him:

"Don Lemon’s statement about this morning’s events is inaccurate. He was offered an opportunity to meet with management but instead released a statement on Twitter."

\u201cDon Lemon\u2019s statement about this morning\u2019s events is inaccurate. He was offered an opportunity to meet with management but instead released a statement on Twitter.\u201d
— CNN Communications (@CNN Communications) 1682355595

Twitter users also added context to Lemon's original tweet that reads, "Per CNN PR, the statement 'is inaccurate. He was offered an opportunity to meet with management but instead released a statement on Twitter.'"

It's unclear what exactly led to Lemon's termination. But it may have had something to do with his history of disdain towards women. Particularly women over fifty, or women who demand unreasonable salary increases despite underwhelming performances (*cough* U.S. soccer *cough*). Whatever the reason, he will certainly be missed. I think.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch The Absolutely Legendary Last Moments of Tucker Carlson Tonight, Eating Pizza With Hero Deliveryman
description:
As you are all probably aware by now, Tucker Carlson is no longer with Fox News. And if this is the first you're hearing of this...sorry to be the bearer of bad news.

On the bright side, Tucker's last moments on Fox were some for the books. He invited Tyler Morrell, a pizza delivery man who tripped a suspected car thief, in studio to eat pizza with him.

Iconic.

\u201cHere were the final moments of @TuckerCarlson Tonight - #Tucker's final guest was the pizza deliveryman who tripped up a suspected car thief. The driver - Tyler Morrell - brought a bunch of pizzas, so the two sat and ate them while mocking the thief.\n\n"We'll be back on Monday!"\u201d
— Curtis Houck (@Curtis Houck) 1682352525

Morrell has only worked for Cocco's Pizzeria in Brookhaven about three months before he found himself involved in a police foot chase that resulted in him tripping the suspect. He described the ordeal to Law and Crime:

"He’s [the suspect] just spinning his tires in the grass. The cops pull up behind him. You can see that he’s trying to get out [of the car] – he keeps trying to get out. And he gets out eventually – and the cops weren’t even out of their car yet. But he was full sprint. So, I was like, ‘I dunno if they’re gonna be able to get him.'”

"I just didn’t even wanna take the chance, like, I didn’t wanna watch and be like, ‘Oh, just let them run and get him,’ you know? Make them chase him down. Who knows what could’ve happened after that? So, I literally just – I was like, I can’t use my hands – I probably would have tackled him if I could.”

“I was like, I gotta keep the pizza good. I gotta get the cash for the pizza. Because, I’m thinking: ‘I can’t – I’m not gonna lose the money at the end of the day.'”

And then he strolled up to the criminal, pizza box in hand, and tripped him.

\u201chttps://t.co/HRZBhhjzcV\u201d
— Davy Jones (@Davy Jones) 1681769445

Just two legends eating pizza. What a fitting way to go out.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Breaking: Tucker Carlson is OUT at Fox News, last episode was last Friday
description:
It was just announced that Tucker Carlson and Fox News have agreed to part ways.

NEW YORK — April 24, 2023 — FOX News Media and Tucker Carlson have agreed to part ways. We thank him for his service to the network as a host and prior to that as a contributor.

Mr. Carlson’s last program was Friday April 21st. Fox News Tonight will air live at 8 PM/ET starting this evening as an interim show helmed by rotating FOX News personalities until a new host is named.

This is a developing story. All there is to go on is a press release by the news network. Crowder reacted to the news live on air.

I hope @rumblevideo is watching... #TuckerCarlson pic.twitter.com/YNADGoCHi6
— Steven Crowder (@scrowder) April 24, 2023


The timing is, at the very least, curious. Carlson was blowing up the internet over the weekend with this viral clip on good and evil.

You really should watch this. pic.twitter.com/KAEeKt15eX
— Colin Smothers (@colinsmo) April 23, 2023

The news was also announced the DAY AFTER social media influencer Rep. AOC, during an interview with Joe Biden's former press secretary, called on the White House to do something about Tucker Carlson.

In an interview with Psaki, AOC talks about regulations and claims that "when you look at what Tucker Carlson and some of these other folks on Fox do, it is very very clearly incitement of violence." pic.twitter.com/eFVGn5FBVS
— The Post Millennial (@TPostMillennial) April 23, 2023

It's not as if this is the first time a leftist social media influencer has called for the popular conservative to be canceled. My guess? This was a long time coming between Carlson and Fox News. He hinted towards a change in attitude recently on the Full Send podcast.

After watching this video, you do realize Tucker could be fired for saying this😳. Given how he really feels, I’d say HE’S GONE from Fox within a year🤔. Seriously, if his heart is saying this, how can he stay in legacy media🤷🏼♂️ pic.twitter.com/0ArAZhJjpA
— Bobby D (@BobDunlap9477) March 14, 2023

We will update the story as more info becomes available.

title: Watch: Crowder And Gerald Explain New Housing Rule That Will Punish Responsible Americans
description:
Crowder kicked off another week of Louder with Crowder with a hot segment on mortgages. Crowder set up the segment by pointing out the new federal housing rule that will punish Americans who have lived their lives in a disciplined way .. The rule will require responsible Americans to pay higher mortgages to offset high-risk lenders.

Crowder then played a clip of Scott Bolden, the former chairman of the D.C. Democratic Party, explaining how this rule is essentially a penalty for good credit and a high down payment. He said he is refinancing two of his properties to avoid the penalty.

Crowder explained the rule will require buyers with a credit score of 680 or more to pay $40 more per month on a $400,000 loan, and the amount increases depending on the size of the loan. Americans who make down payments of 20% on their homes will pay the highest fees. The payments are used to subsidize higher-risk borrows through lower fees.

Gerald then took the reins in a new segment titled, "Gerald Knows Things". He explained this rule basically means higher fees. One of the things when you buy a house, Gerald said, is that your credit score matters, and the line is set at 630. From a financial perspective, 630 is not great. Though this new rule is at 680, Gerald said it is still a tax on the middle class.

Crowder pointed out that, what used to be requirements (a high down payment, a good credit score) are now penalties. Crowder and crew got through a lot more info on this segment, plus AOC's latest communist rant about Tucker Carlson and Fox News. Be sure to tune in to the whole show exclusively on Rumble.

>

<

title: WATCH: Jen Psaki Gets Ice Cream With John Kerry In Embarrassingly Softball Interview
description:
Jen Psaki is really following through on her promise to ask the hard-hitting questions of all her friends in the Biden administration. Such as whether John Kerry would like a little sweet treat.

Sigh.

During a segment of "Inside with Jen Psaki," Psaki interviewed Kerry on the National Mall.

"Now I remember well that you have a bit of a sweet tooth. Do you want to go get some ice cream over there?" Kerry replied, "That would be - hitting the nail on the head."

\u201cJen Psaki with a hard-hitting interview of John Kerry:\n\n"I remember well that you have a bit of a sweet tooth. Do you want to go get some ice cream?"\u201d
— RNC Research (@RNC Research) 1682270922

The pair proceeded to an ice cream stand and both got Dove bars, which Psaki called the "State Department special". As they munched their ice cream, Psaki said, "So I know you like Forrest Gump. A little bit. Does this remind you - you've lived a life a little bit like Forrest Gump." Kerry then claimed he's had some "Forrest Gump moments". Whatever that means.

Kerry also recalled his mother's influence on his passion for environmental activism and praised the younger generations for their involvement in the fight against climate change. Like vandalizing oil paintings and gluing themselves to the floor. Such bravery.

Psaki actually served as Kerry's spokesperson at the State Department during the Obama administration, which explains her softball questions. Steve Guest, Ted Cruz's special adviser for communications, quote tweeted the clip with a 2014 photo of Psaki and Kerry where Psaki donned a Russian communist hammer-and-sickle hat.

"'Journalism' featuring Jen Psaki and John Kerry," Guest wrote.

\u201c\u201cJournalism\u201d featuring Jen Psaki and John Kerry:\u201d
— Steve Guest (@Steve Guest) 1682273508

And just a few weeks ago, Psaki said she considers herself a journalist: “I do ... To me, journalism is providing information to the public, helping make things clear, explaining things, having conversations with people that people want to learn more about.”

\u201c.@semaforben asks @jrpsaki if she considers herself a journalist:\n\n\u201cI do ... To me, journalism is providing information to the public, helping make things clear, explaining things, having conversations with people that people want to learn more about.\u201d\u201d
— Semafor (@Semafor) 1681161729

So far as a journalist, Psaki has explained to the public that the Biden administration officials really enjoy ice cream. And something about Forrest Gump. Truly groundbreaking stuff.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

description:

title: A Pennsylvania School District Shut Down All Of Its Locker Rooms Because Of A Single Trans Student
description:
A Pennsylvania school board has decided that, instead of asking students to please use the locker room that corresponds to their genitalia, they'll just ban students from entering the locker rooms at all. Problem solved.

The decision was prompted by numerous complaints from parents about a trans-identified student using the boys' locker room. One parent explained her son would not change in the locker room if a girl was in there.

\u201cNot wanting to ban a #trans student who is using the opposite sex's locker room at a high school in Lebanon, Penn., the school board decided to shut down all the locker rooms for the remainder of the school year. https://t.co/R7qZa4u5To\u201d
— Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08 (@Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08) 1682294157

In an 8 to 1 vote on Monday, the Eastern Lebanon County school district board of directors decided to shutter the locker rooms for the rest of the year. You may be wondering, what about when kids have to change for gym? The board has directed all students to simply come to school in their gym clothes, and presumably remain in their sweaty workout gear for the rest of the day. Because trans rights.

High School principal Jennifer Haas explained in an email, "Students may not change clothes in restrooms or other parts of the building before, during, or after their Physical Education class. At the start of the class period, students will meet in the gym and will store personal belongings in a designated location that is monitored by security cameras within the gym area.” But she did note, "Locker rooms will remain available for use by athletic teams after the school day for time periods established by the District Administration." How kind of them.

Superintendent Julia Vicente claimed in a letter to parents, "This directive has been enacted to allow the Board to consider options that respect the confidentiality and privacy of all students who use the High School locker rooms during the instructional day."

Or they could just, y'know, have boys change in the boys' locker room, and girls change in the girls'. But that is apparently too much to ask in 2023.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: WATCH: Charles Barkley To Host Primetime Show On CNN As Network Desperately Tries To Boost Ratings
description:
CNN has snagged Charles Barkley in its latest attempt to be less partisan. During an NBA pregrame show on Saturday, Gayle King announced Barkley will host a primetime program called "King Charles". The program will air every Wednesday.

King explained,"What I think is so great for the both of us is that it's live TV. And to me, live TV is like working without a net. Don't you feel that? So whatever happens, happens."

Barkley and King both revealed they hadn't been looking for another job, as Barkley explained, "When they said something, I said, hell no, I don't want to be on TV more. And then - this is when they first brought it up, and they said, 'What about Gayle?' And I said, 'Gayle who?' And they said Gayle King, and I said, 'oh yeah, I'll work with Gayle.' That's the only way."

\u201cComing this fall, King Charles with Gayle King and Charles Barkley will air weekly on CNN in primetime running into 2024. Hear Gayle and Charles talk about their new show on @NBAonTNT.\u201d
— CNN Communications (@CNN Communications) 1682184462

The pair explained that, though the show will discuss politics, they will do so without any political labels. Barkley said that all he wants is people to be honest with him, as opposed to trying to get clickbait. He also said, as an example, he doesn't want to just glaze over all the mass shootings that keep happening. He specifically mentioned a young Texas girl who was recently shot in her cheerleader uniform after her friend approached the wrong car. However, he then said that even though he's a "pro-gun guy," it shouldn't be "easy" to get guns. Which sounds a teensy bit political. But we'll see.

This announcement comes just as CNN is desperately in need of a ratings boost. According to Mediaite, the network averaged just 470,000 viewers last Thursday, compared to Fox News's average of 1.48 million viewers and 2.54 million prime time viewers. It must be because they canned Brian Stelter.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Hollywood's lashing out at Robert Kennedy's actress wife over his Democratic challenge to Joe Biden
description:
Joe Biden is expected to announce is reelection run for president this week, and he already has a challenger. Robert Kennedy Jr. Bobby Kennedy's son. And progressives are pissed. So much so they are taking it out on... Kennedy's wife?

Thank you to my wife Cheryl Hines for her love and support. pic.twitter.com/d7hZ8MPbg9
— Robert F. Kennedy Jr (@RobertKennedyJr) April 19, 2023

Actress Cheryl Hines (Curb Your Enthusiasm, Waitress) has allegedly started to LOSE work in Hollywood over her husband -- a Kennedy -- challenging Joe Biden -- who 51% of Democrats don't want to run again -- for the presidency. RFK Jr. spoke to Breitbart News.

BREITBART: I wonder if you share some of the fears many Americans have of the cancel culture. You spoke about your wife, actress Cheryl Hines, potential first lady. She’s a very talented actress, very funny. Has she faced that kind of fear? That kind of pressure because you’re challenging an incumbent president from the Democratic Party? Do you think that she will face pressure from Hollywood?
KENNEDY: I don’t want to go into details, but I can tell you that she has already lost … In fact, she lost one today. I can tell you, yes, there is a cancel culture. It’s alarming.

Hollywood's (alleged) actions aren't surprising. They hate it when anyone has a single opposing viewpoint, or in this case, supports someone who does.

Plus Kennedy has been a thorn in Biden's side by speaking out against the SCHMOVID narrative as well as a host of other issues. And I know he's Fox News's favorite Democrat for the same reason Donald Trump is everyone else in mainstream media's favorite Republican. It just boggles my mind that Bobby Kennedy's son is persona non-grata in the 2023 Democrat Party.

This isn't a random Kennedy cousin. This is the actual HEIR TO CAMELOT. We joke that the Democrat Party has gotten so extreme, John F. Kennedy wouldn't recognize it anymore. His nephew running so that Dems have a moderate option proves it.

Though I mostly feel bad for John F. Kennedy Jr. The guy goes and fakes his own death so that he can become Q and work with Trump to expose the deep state and all the pedophiles in Hollywood. And here comes his cousin along to f*ck everything up.

(Please note that the proceeding paragraph was written in sarcasm font)

title: Elon Musk ENDS NYT "economist," other whiny #BlockTheBlue liberals with the single perfect meme
description:
While you were off enjoying the weekend and being a productive member of society, or at the very least day drinking, now former bluecheckmarks on Twitter were crying and kvetching... on Twitter. So of course Elon Musk, the Head Twit In Charge, needed to troll.

To recap, on 4/20 any legacy bluecheckmark lost their flair unless they subscribed to Twitter Blue. Lashing out, the most insufferable among them launched #BlockTheBlue. The pledge was to block anyone who subscribed to Twitter Blue. "But Brodigan, didn't YOU subscribe to Twitter Blue?" Yes, I have to live with the fact the band Eve6 is mad at me for it.

Elon being Elon, he gave the rabblest of the rousers their checkmark back. So they now have to block themselves.

People like alleged "economist" Paul Krugman were quick to make sure you knew he didn't pay for his checkmark. He's not one of "those" people.

So my blue check has reappeared. I had nothing to do with that, and am definitely not paying
— Paul Krugman (@paulkrugman) April 23, 2023

Elon delivered a fatality.

pic.twitter.com/31P6jAVP2C
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) April 23, 2023

It serves people like Krugman right. Elon TRIED working with them. He knows how difficult it is for them as elitist celebrities and journalismers to chip in eight bucks. He started a fund to help them out.

We’ve started a “save-a-celebrity fund” to pay their $8. We take this matter very seriously.
— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) April 21, 2023

Some people are ungrateful and unworthy of Elon's love. So he's going to meme them to death. A more appropriate punishment does not exist.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Professor's research on transgender sports gets rejected by woke university because it uses the word "male"
description:
The debate about allowing transgender girls (who were born dudes) to compete against girls has been raging since the 2010s. Ever since Fallon Fox was smashing orbital bones and Mack Beggs was choking girls out. A professor would like to research the topic, but his proposal has been rejected. Using the word "male" -- in research about males competing against females -- is misgendering so his university yeeted the proposal.

Who could have guessed in 2018 that one day this photo would define a generation? pic.twitter.com/EzlSBktBn4
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) April 21, 2023

King’s College London Professor John Armstrong wanted to research the controversial topic. He was ASKED TO by the UK Athlete’s Commission. They were working on a policy about trans inclusion in sports, and had a crazy idea that the opinions and voices of athletes affected by the policy should be heard. Professor Armstrong did too.

King's College did not.

I submitted a proposal for ethical review at Kings College London which stated that the aim of the research was “to find the views of athletes and volunteers on the question of when males should be allowed to compete in the female category in athletics”. The ethics committee rejected the proposal, on the grounds that using the terms “male” and “female” in this sentence constituted “misgendering”.

The college didn't have a problem with the survey questions. Just if the word "male" or "female" was anywhere in the research, Research, on how athletes feels about people who were born males competing against people who were born females.

I'm assuming the research would also include thoughts on people born females competing against people born males as well. But for some unknown reason, it isn't people born female dominating in male sports. Nor is it people born female giving people born male concussions. Armstrong's research could have shed light on why this is.

The professor was told he had to speak to the university's Equality Diversity and Inclusion (EDI) team about, quote, “wording used in the survey” and as well as the “presentation of the research”.

Asking our EDI team for assistance seems unlikely to improve the quality of the research. Our EDI team is part of the university’s human resources function and has no particular research expertise. Until recently, it was teaching in a course aimed at senior managers that sex was a spectrum from male to female with “intersex” somewhere in between.

Odd that an elite university would hamper scientific research by having it micromanaged by a department that has no science or research background. It would be as if Big Tech companies allowed partisan non-profits to determine what is "misinformation" when discussing medical issues on Facebook, even though the non-profits have no scientific background themselves.

In America, the House of Representatives passed the Protection of Women and Girls in Sports Act. The bill faces a veto threat from President Biden. Critics are unclear why Biden supports watching girls having their hopes and dreams (and bones) crushed by boys who went through male puberty. He is expected to announce his reelection campaign this week.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
